page.title: 09DAYS GONE BY
page.content: Sometimes the children used to go to the cinema in Moorends or THorne. Their parents might go to the 'sixpenny hop' which was a dance held on a Friday night. Although they did not have television, they did have gramaphones. They also had radios and some were the type that had earphones. They listened to programmes like the Ovaltinies, The Goon Show and Journey Into Space. When the children played in the street they played games like these: Skipping, firing cardboard milk-bottle tops onto the wall and marbles. They also played hopscotch, tracking and lamp-post swinging. On Sunday nights the whole family would take part in a get-together singsong. They had no Bingo. It was hard on the younger children because they never got new clothes.
